groupPage.PsychologicalSafetyText1: In this team, I feel like I can fail openly.
groupPage.PsychologicalSafetyText2: I know my colleaguesâ€™ positive characteristics and strengths very well.
groupPage.PsychologicalSafetyText3: In this team, I feel comfortable showing my vulnerability.
groupPage.ConstructiveFeedbackText1: In this team, members frequently exchange constructive feedback
groupPage.ConstructiveFeedbackText2: This team regularly recognises my achievements and successes.
groupPage.ConstructiveFeedbackText3: My colleagues get easily defensive when they happen to receive criticism.
groupPage.CognitiveBiasText1: I feel that my team prefers to maintain a harmony over being disturbed by conflicts.
groupPage.CognitiveBiasText2: A high-performing team creates less errors and mistakes than those which are mediocre
groupPage.CognitiveBiasText3: In our team, juniors regularly seek ideas from seniors.
groupPage.SocialNormsText1: In meetings, one person or a small group tends to speak most of the time.
groupPage.SocialNormsText2: In this team, members withhold information that might be useful for others.
groupPage.SocialNormsText3: This team has a strong sense of collective success rather than just individual glory.
groupPage.NoMatrixInfo: There is currently no matrix information available.

groupQuizQuestion.HowOftenCompliment: How often do you get compliment
groupQuizQuestion.IdealPraiseRatio: Ideal ratio of praise : Criticism at work?
groupQuizQuestion.TeamSharedGoal: What is the shared goal of your team?
groupQuizQuestion.RankDiscussionBehaviour: An effective, productive discussion requires many different behaviors. Please rank which behaviors you think are most important, from top to bottom.
groupQuizQuestion.HadToChoosePrefer: If I had to choose, I would prefer to
groupQuizQuestion.RankCriticismGiver: Criticms can be difficult to handle, depending on who gives them. Please rank from top to bottom which people are the most difficult to get criticism from.
groupQuizQuestion.BestCriticismGiver: Who in your group was the best criticism giver?
groupQuizQuestion.RankBehaviourImprovement: Which of the behaviours below do you most wish to work on? Rank the answers.

groupQuizAnswer.Answer3: Begin a meeting with small talk
groupQuizAnswer.Answer3A: Begin meetings with business right away
groupQuizAnswer.Answer3B: Be sure members take equal turns during a discussion
groupQuizAnswer.Answer3C: It's often necessary to cut people off when they are talking
groupQuizAnswer.Answer3D: Disagreements in the meeting should be minimized
groupQuizAnswer.Answer3E: Leaders at the meeting should speak first, and guide the discussion
groupQuizAnswer.Answer4: Give a difficult and unpleasant criticism
groupQuizAnswer.Answer4A: Receive a difficult and unpleasant criticism
groupQuizAnswer.Answer6: In meetings, I'll try to talk a bit less.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer6A: I'll work more toward the success of the team than for my personal glory
groupQuizAnswer.Answer6B: I'll speak up about more problems and issues, and not fear being judged by others
groupQuizAnswer.Answer6C: I'll give more compliments to my peers
groupQuizAnswer.Answer6D: I'll try to not be defensive when my colleagues criticise me
groupQuizAnswer.Answer7: I felt safe speaking up my mind
groupQuizAnswer.Answer7A: I talk about things that I usually don't share with my team
groupQuizAnswer.Answer7B: I learned how to give constructive feedback
groupQuizAnswer.Answer7C: I learned new, positive attributes of my colleagues
groupQuizAnswer.Answer7D: The way we handle communication during the session was more effective than our usual team meetings.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer7E: I see value of this session and want to recommend it to others
